cz.melkamar.andruian.indexer.service

Class QueryService

  • java.lang.Object
    • cz.melkamar.andruian.indexer.service.QueryService

  • @Service
public class QueryService
extends java.lang.Object
    A service providing querying functionality. It communicates with the Data Access Objects to fetch data based on given parameters.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      QueryService(PlaceDAO placeDAO, ClusteredPlaceDAO clusteredPlaceDAO) 

    • Method Summary

      Run a query and return clusters of matching data.
      java.util.List<Place> query(java.lang.String type, java.lang.Double latitude, java.lang.Double longitude, java.lang.Double radius)
      Run a query and return matching data.

    • Constructor Detail

      • QueryService

        @Autowired
public QueryService(PlaceDAO placeDAO,
                                ClusteredPlaceDAO clusteredPlaceDAO)

    • Method Detail

      • query

        public java.util.List<Place> query(@Nullable
                                   java.lang.String type,
                                   @Nullable
                                   java.lang.Double latitude,
                                   @Nullable
                                   java.lang.Double longitude,
                                   @Nullable
                                   java.lang.Double radius)
                            throws QueryFormatException
        Run a query and return matching data.
        Parameters:
        type - The IRI of the RDF class to search for. If not provided, objects of all classes are returned.
        latitude - The latitude around which to search for objects. Specified as floating-point coordinate using the WGS84 system. Either none or all of latitude, longitude and radius must be provided.
        longitude - The longitude around which to search for objects. Specified as floating-point coordinate using the WGS84 system. Either none or all of latitude, longitude and radius must be provided.
        radius - The radius of the circle, centered on the given lat long coordinates, in which to search for objects. The unit is kilometers. Either none or all of latitude, longitude and radius must be provided.
        Returns:
        A list of places that match the given query.
        Throws:
        QueryFormatException - The format of the query is invalid - likely because some but not all of latitude, longitude and radius were provided.

      • clusteredQuery

        public java.util.List<PlaceCluster> clusteredQuery(@Nullable
                                                   java.lang.String type,
                                                   @Nullable
                                                   java.lang.Double latitude,
                                                   @Nullable
                                                   java.lang.Double longitude,
                                                   @Nullable
                                                   java.lang.Double radius)
                                            throws QueryFormatException
        Run a query and return clusters of matching data.
        Parameters:
        type - The IRI of the RDF class to search for. If not provided, objects of all classes are returned.
        latitude - The latitude around which to search for objects. Specified as floating-point coordinate using the WGS84 system. Either none or all of latitude, longitude and radius must be provided.
        longitude - The longitude around which to search for objects. Specified as floating-point coordinate using the WGS84 system. Either none or all of latitude, longitude and radius must be provided.
        radius - The radius of the circle, centered on the given lat long coordinates, in which to search for objects. The unit is kilometers. Either none or all of latitude, longitude and radius must be provided.
        Returns:
        A list of clusters containing places that match the given query.
        Throws:
        QueryFormatException - The format of the query is invalid - likely because some but not all of latitude, longitude and radius were provided.
